pinkforest opened issue #4957:

Problem now is that anyone using 0.40.0 via wasi-common will get 0.25 cap-std and therefore incompat cap-primitives

There is a work/around here: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936

Work/around in turn breaks unix builds as described here: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936#issuecomment-1257183650

Could we address so this builds for both Windows and Linux via 0.40 ?

Perhaps bump wasi-common so it bumps up to 0.26 ?

But I think the build errors need to be sorted for unix as I suspect the patch has broken all unix now ? https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936#issuecomment-1257183650

Cheers

Problem now is that anyone using 0.40 via wasi-common will get 0.25 cap-std

I would have to bump everything to ^1 atm

pinkforest edited issue #4957:

Problem now is that anyone using 0.40 via wasi-common will get 0.25 cap-std

And therefore incompat cap-primitives in Windows when using stable > 0.64.0 rust version that has sealed the trait

< 1 builds broken

I would have to bump everything to ^1 atm

Work/Around - Works for Windows

There is a work/around here: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936

Work/Around does not work for unix

Work/around in turn breaks unix builds as described here: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936#issuecomment-1257183650

Resolution

Could we address so this builds for both Windows and Linux / unix via 0.40 ?

Perhaps we could also bump wasi-common so it bumps up to 0.26 that whole chain for cap-primitives ?

But I think the build errors need to be sorted for unix as I suspect the patch has broken all unix now ? https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936#issuecomment-1257183650

│   │   │   │   │   ├── cap-primitives v0.25.2

And therefore incompat cap-primitives in Windows when using stable > 0.64.0 rust version that has sealed the trait

Resolution

Could we address so this builds for both Windows and Linux / unix via 0.40 ?

Perhaps we could also bump wasi-common so it bumps up to 0.26 that whole chain for cap-primitives ?

But I think the build errors need to be sorted for unix as I suspect the patch has broken all unix now ? https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/4936#issuecomment-1257183650
